notesStmt.note: A number of the extant leaves are imperfectly preserved. Folios 1, 2, 3, 11, 49, 77-89 are seriosuly damaged. Folios 90, 91, 97-100 are imperfectly preserved.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Fragments of the Arabic commentaries on Numbers and Deuteronomy, and parts of Sefer ha-mitsṿot.

collation.p:
Quires of originally 12 leaves each.
Quires signed with Arabic numerals on the upper margin of the first page, and with catchwords on the lower margin of the last page.
Only quires nos. 13-24, 25-26, 37-48 are complete.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Two different Naskhi hands of approximately 12th century. A Naskhi hand of the 12th century. A cursive Naskhi hand of 12th century.
